datasetFiles.name: 'Other' type file URI
datasetFiles.value: ftp://ftp.pride.ebi.ac.uk/pride/data/archive/2019/01/PXD006858/Kotsiri et al. 2017-SIPC analysis by LC-MS:MS results.xlsx

description: Settlement-inducing protein complex (SIPC) is a protein that acts as a phoromone cue to attract conspecific of the barnacle Amphibalanus amphitrite to settle on a substrate. Recombinant settlement-inducing protein complex was expressed in insect Sf9 cells through a baculovirus overexpression system, purified and analysed by mass spectrometry to confirm its identity.

keywords.name: submitter keyword
keywords.value: Settlement-inducing protein complex, SIPC, Amphibalanus anphitrite, settlement assays, biofouling

terms.name: Reference
terms.value: Kotsiri M, Protopapa M, Mouratidis S, Zachariadis M, Vassilakos D, Kleidas I, Samiotaki M, Dedos SG. Should I stay or should I go? The settlement-inducing protein complex guides barnacle settlement decisions. J Exp Biol. 2018 221(pt 22)

title: Identification of recombinant settlement-inducing protein complex from Amphibalanus amphitrite by LC-MS/MS
